description: On December 12, the Hamas-run Gaza health ministry reported that Israeli forces had entered Kamal Adwan hospital, a claim later confirmed by the IDF.
maintext:
A man claiming to be the director of the hospital in Gaza, allegedly being used as a base for Hamas, has apparently confirmed the use of the hospital by the terrorist group, in a video released by the IDF. Allegations have emerged from an Israeli Shin Bet interrogation of Ahmed Kahlot, the director of Gaza's Kamal Adwan hospital in Jabaliya.
The hospital, located in northern Gaza, was allegedly converted into a military facility under the control of Hamas, according to Kahlot's testimony.
In footage released by the Shin Bet and Israel Defense Forces (IDF) on Tuesday, Kahlot claimed that Hamas had established offices within the hospital and used it as a base for operational activities.
He claimed that 16 members of the hospital's staff, including doctors, nurses, and paramedics, were Hamas operatives serving in the al-Qassam Brigades, the military wing of the organisation. Kahlot further claimed that members of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad's Al-Quds Brigades were also employed in the hospital.
title: Gaza hospital boss captured by Israel 'admits he is senior Hamas terrorist'
